result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Pre-trial conference on July 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:55 AM Defendant Anthony P. Pedretti in court.  Attorney Crystal Leigh Jensen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Greg A Tainter in court for Anthony P. Pedretti.  Defense stipulated to deputies training and experience and stipulates to 4 priors. previous convictions. court recognizes the stipulations.  State calls witness  Deputy RW; sworn; testifies. responded to complaint, testifies to the initiated traffic stop. Observed defendant confused, odor of alcohol, identified defendant. Record reflects identification.  
Defendant refused field sobriety test, arrested by witness. Blood results BAC .035. Cross examination by Attorney Tainter. One reason for stop illegal lane change. No redirect. State rests moves for bind over. Probable cause found. 

Arraignment date set for 8/1 @ 3 PM. PTC date set for 7/20.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on July 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver of preliminary hearing time limits.  He stated he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived his right to have a preliminary hearing within time limits.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located. 
Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: Ho-Chunk Gaming Properties located in Jackson County

1:01 PM Defendant Anthony P. Pedretti appeared by video, in custody from Jackson County Jail.  Attorney Crystal Leigh Jensen in court for State of Wisconsin. Court advised the defendant of the charges and possible penalties contained in the complaint.  He understood.  Court explained his attorney rights. He will contact counsel.  AIA set for 5/9 at 9 am.
